item.title: #en @ 1484548800136069121
item.description:
17/24 Majority of The Graphâ€™s queries currently come from the ETH ecosystem, but it supports 26 networks on the hosted service.
This chain agnostic feature positions it to be a universal open data layer for all of web3, regardless of the layer 1 or 2 devs decide to build on.

item.title: #en @ 1484548787284631553
item.description:
7/24 @graphprotocol enables â€œdata composabilityâ€.
Over time, The Graph becomes an open data layer for Web3, where indexers ensure data is updated/live, and subgraphs are â€œdata legosâ€, like the $ legos of #DeFi, that any developer can access and combine to feed their dapp.

item.title: #en @ 1484195313153945606
item.description: Open data sharing claims to help benefit all humans. But Indigenous Peoples have found that sharing their genomic data has not benefitted their own communities. Researchers rarely come back to the Tribes after collecting their data.

item.title: #en @ 1484195307013427200
item.description: A new paper published in PNAS asks researchers to rethink the meaning of open data sharing and what genomics researchers need to change to build trust among communities previously harmed by it. https://t.co/YcllX4WhTU
